summary.p: The bearer [...] will tell the news, as Bullinger has no time to write. He has communicated the useful content of the recently arrived letter from Vadian [not received] to Mayor [Johannes] Haab and is waiting for Vadian's [promised] letter. Any news from Lower Germany will be forwarded to Vadian.

div.p: Greetings. The bearer of this letter, most illustrious man, will be a living letter to you; for I was too exhausted to write what I wanted. I thank you for the recent letter, which I have shared with Mr. Haab; for it seemed to be very useful. I am expecting your letter at any moment. If I receive any news from Lower Germany, you will not be unaware of it.
To the most illustrious man, Dr. Joachim Vadian, my ever-honored lord.
